column1: The 'Leeds' label on the 1880s rainfall sheet is wrong - this Wortley is the one about 5 miles south-west of Barnsley, not the Wortley on the west side of Leeds.
This was an MS&L Railway site, part of its Woodhead Railway line.

The grid reference above is for Wortley Station, but nearby Wortley Hall (SK312995) was owned by the Earl of Warncliffe, chairman of MS&LR, and so the gauge might have been located in its grounds rather than at the station.
